Annual Crop Land: Regular geometric patterns of cultivated fields.
Forest: Dense, continuous canopy cover from overhead perspective.
Herbaceous Vegetation Land: 'Predominantly lush, dense coverage with continuous uniform texture.'
Highway or Road: Linear structures connecting various geographic points.
Industrial Buildings: Large structures with prominent geometric shapes and patterns.
Pasture Land: Distinctive patchwork of divided, flat agricultural fields.
Permanent Crop Land: Grid-like patterns of perennial crops on landscape.
Residential Buildings: Distinct clusters of box-like structures with surrounding open spaces.
River: Flowing body of water cutting through landscapes.
Sea or Lake: Visible water bodies surrounded by landmass.
